refnamediv.refpurpose: Creates or increments an integer counter for a given key and a dictionary.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The function checks whether dict contains key. If it isn't so then the function checks the datatype of the value associated with the key. An error 42000 is signalled in case of non-integer value or a negative integer value. If the value is positive then value_decrement is added to it and the result become the new value associated with key in dict. If key is not in the dictionary then a new item is added to the dict in order to associate the key with value_increment.

refsect2.title: dict
refsect2.para: Dictionary of counters. If the value is NULL then the function immediately returns zero.

refsect2.title: key
refsect2.para: Key of a dictionary item to process.

refsect2.title: value decrement
refsect2.para: A nonnegative integer (typically 1) that is added to the value associated with key or used as a starting value of a newly created counter.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: The function returns zero (for NULL dict) or the changed (or the added) value associated with the key.

example.title: Simple Use
example.para: The function is convenient to deal with multisets, i.e., sets with repeating elements. In this case the dictionary contains distinct items as keys and counts of duplicates as associated values. dict_inc_or_add is to add a member, dict_dec_or_remove is to remove.
